intro: Hymenoxys scaposa, commonly known as the scarlet globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, bright orange to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Hymenoxys scaposa typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, hairy seeds.
